result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael V. Petta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court hereby enters an Order that the Judgment of Conviction will remain of record and the case file shall be closed due to the defendant being deceased.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael V. Petta

records.addlTxt: Disbursements Journal Final
to Close File /s/ JVF 07/30/15

Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:04 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Court was informed of the untimely demise of Defendant.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, notified that Defendant committed suicide about 8 am, by shooting himself.  

Atty Cousins addresses the Court requests the Court to close the case with a conviction on file.
There are family members of the Defendant present.  If any victim wishes to make a statement, that they should be able to do so.

There is a cash bond on file, State would like the cash be made available for counseling.

Atty Kryshak addresses the Court, feels there is no reason for anyone to speak today. 
Atty Kryshak requests 30 days for restitution to be addressed.

Victim witness coordinator is here, states that mother of the girls have prepared a victim impact statement, would like to file the statement. Mother would like the statement to be read out loud.

Court will read the statement to the Court's self. 

Copies of statement have been handed to both parties.

Record will reflect that the Court read the statement.

Court believes the appropriate procedure would be to leave the conviction intact.  

BY THE COURT:
Conviction will stand. File will be closed. On issue of the bond money, Court will allow 30 days for parties to offer suggestions or applicable law with regards to the restitution.

Atty Cousins will prepare the order to close the file, for the Court's signature.
Sentencing hearing at 07-28-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Michael V. Petta in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:42 am. Court indicates that the Jury has reached a verdict.
10:44 am. Jurors are escorted into the courtroom.
Verdict is read by the Court.

Defendant is found Guilty of 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault by the Jury.

Court thanks the Jurors for their service.
10:46 am. Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.

State requests Court enters judgment on the motion.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders Judgment of conviction be entered.
Court orders a PSI be completed by July 23, 2015.

Atty Kryshak asks for an expedited PSI so that the Court can sentence.

State moves defendant's bond be revoked.
Atty Kryshak objects.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is the same.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Juror notes and responsed from the Court

Defendant Michael V. Petta in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:45 a.m.  Court calls the case.  All jurors are present. 
This is Day 2 of the Jury Trial. 

8L47 a.m.  Officer D. Bailey is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Cousins. 
Cross exam by Atty Kryshak. 
Re-direct exam by Atty Cousins. 
8:52 a.m.  State rests. 
8:53 a.m.  C. Clark is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Kryshak.
Cross exam by Atty Cousins. 
8:55 a.m.  Witness is excused. 

8:56 a.m.  M. Mundinac is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Kryshak. 
Cross exam by Atty Cousins. 

9:01 a.m.  K. Fleischman is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Kryshak. 

9:04 a.m.  Witness is excused.  Jurors are escorted from the Courtroom. 

Atty Kryshak indicates the defendant would like to testify.
Court questions defendant re: testimony.
Court is satisfied that the defendant is freely and voluntarily exercising his right to testify after being fully informed of his constitutional rights by his attorney.  

9:09 a.m.  Jurors are returned to the Courtroom. 
M. Petta is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Kryshak. 
Cross exam by Atty Cousins. 
Re-direct exam by Atty Kryshak. 
Re-cross exam by Atty Cousins. 

9:29 a.m.  Court will take a brief recess. 

9:38 a.m.  Court is back in session outside the presence of the jury. 
Atty Cousins has no rebuttal testimony. 
Court and parties discuss the proposed jury instructions. 
Court questions parties re: agreements to the instructions. 
Parties agree. 
Court reviews the verdict with the parties. 
10:05 a.m.  Jurors are returned to the Courtroom. 
Court administers instructions to the Jury. 

10:15 a.m.  Closing arguments made by Atty Cousins. 
10:44 a.m.  Closing arguments made by Atty Knaapen. 

11:04 a.m.  Court will take a 5 minute recess.  Court advises jurors not to begin deliberations as there is rebuttal argument yet. 

11:11 a.m.  Court is back in session in the presence of the jury. 
Rebuttal arguments by Atty Cousins. 

11:24 a.m.  Court instructs the jury on verdict and deliberations. 
11:26 a.m.  Clerk administers Oath of Officers.
11:27 a.m.  Jurors retire to the jury room to deliberate.  Lunch will be ordered.  
Court addresses the parties re: exhibits.  Court will recess pending the verdict.

2:02 p.m.  Court is back in session outside presence of the jury. 
Court received notes from the jury.  Court reads those.  Parties met in the office and agreed with the response to the jury.  
Exhibit #1 was reviewed by the parties and taken to the jury. 
Exhibit #3 will be played for the jury. 
2:05 p.m.  Jurors are escorted to the Courtroom. 
Parties discuss if the jurors are allowed to take notes.  
Parties agree the jury can take notes. 
2:08 p.m.  Exhibit #3 is played for the jury. 
2:45 p.m.  Video has concluded.  Jurors are returned to the jury room to continue their deliberations. 

3:51 p.m.  Court is back in session in the presence of the jury. 
Court reads the note from the jury and discusses with the jury.  Court asks that the jury to continue deliberations at this time. 

Court addresses the parties.  Court read the supplemental instruction #520.  

3:53 p.m.  Court is in recess during deliberations.

************Clerk is now A.Z.************

5:01 PM Court is back in session.
Court addresses the parties. Court instructed the Bailiff to address the Jury. Jury states they are not making progress.

Court intends to bring the Jury back in and dismiss them.
State has no suggestions.
Defense has no suggestions.

5:02 PM Jurors enter the courtroom.

Court addresses the foreperson. Foreperson states that some progress has been made.  Court offers 20 more minutes.
Foreperson states that an agreement wouldn't be reached in 20 minutes, may need more time. 

5:04 PM Jurors return to the juryroom to discuss further option of having more time or returning Monday.

5:04 PM Court is in recess until further contact from Jury.

5:23 PM Court is back in session.
Court reads note from Jury, have made progress but will not be concluded within 10 minutes.

5:25 PM Jurors enter the courtroom.
Court questions Jurors. Foreperson addresses the Court, feels there can be more progress on Monday.

BY THE COURT:
Court will have Jurors come back on Monday.
Court appreciates the effort the Jurors have made so far.
Court advises Jurors to have a relaxing weekend and not to discuss this with anyone. 

Jurors are to return at 9 am on Monday.

5:27 PM Jurors are excused for the day.

5:28 PM Court is in recess.

Jury Trial exhibits #1 thru #3
   Exhibit #P1 Front/Back View of figure for A.B.F.
   Exhibit #P2 Front/Back View of figure for M.R.F.
   Exhibit #P3 CD with interviews with A.B.F. and M.R.F.

Defendant Michael V. Petta in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Juror #1938 has failed to appear.
8:28 a.m.  Exhibit #1-#3 marked for Atty Cousins.
8:36 a.m.  Court calls case.
Clerk administer's the Voir Dire Oath.
Potential Juror's chosen are:  1886, 1940, 1933, 1912, 2003, 1937, 2009, 1924, 1934, 1974, 1956, 1978, 2033, 1986, 1973, 1892, 1949, 1971, 1899 and 1942.
8:44 a.m.  Court administer's Voir Dire.
Court inform's the Juror's of the function of being on a Jury Trial.
8:50 a.m.  Court inform's the Juror's of the schedule for today's Jury Trial.
Juror #1866 addresses a concern he has if the Trial would go into Monday; Court inform's that this should not be the case (not guaranteed) and Jury Trial should conclude on Friday the 5th day of June.
8:52 a.m.  Atty Kryshak states that the date had been Amended on the Information and Atty Cousins stipulate's to the date change (Court corrects the Information).
Court informs the Juror's of the charge brought against the Defendant.
Court introduces the parties involved in today's Jury Trial.
Atty Cousins states the witnesses that he may call, on the record, for the State.
Atty Kryshak states the witnesses that he may call, on the record, for the Defense.
8:58 a.m.  Atty Cousins administers Voir Dire. 
9:09 a.m.  Atty Cousins would ask that Juror #1899 be excused; Atty Kryshak object's.
Court will reserve the right to excuse Juror #1899 after Atty Kryshak administers his Voir Dire.
Atty Kryshak now stipulates to excusing Juror #1899.
9:11 a.m.  Juror #1899 is excused and replaced with Juror #1947.
9:29 a.m.  Atty Kryshak administers Voir Dire.
9:31 a.m.  Attorney's will exercise their peremptory strikes; each Attorney will get 4 strikes.
9:40 a.m.  Juror's chosen  are:  1892, 1924, 1933, 1934, 1937, 1940, 1956, 1971, 1973, 1974, 2003 and 2009.
9:41 a.m.  Clerk administers the Juror's Oath.
Juror' not chosen are thanked for their service and excused for the day.
Court provides the Juror's with some informative issues and issues that may happen throughout the Jury Trial. 
9:48 a.m.  Juror's are excused and Court is in recess.
10:06 a.m.  Court is back in session.
Atty Cousins gives opening argument.
10:23 a.m.  Atty Kryshak gives opening argument.
10:34 a.m.  Opening argument's are concluded.
Bailiff provides the Juror's with pencil/paper for note taking.
10:35 a.m.  Linda Hill (f/k/a Petta) is sworn in.
Atty Cousins moves for a sequestration of any witnesses that may be called.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Witness identifies the defendant; Atty Kryshak so stipulates and Court indicates that the witness has identified the defendant.
10:40 a.m.  Atty Kryshak objects; overruled.
10:46 a.m.  Atty Cousins woulde like to take up a legal issue with the Court; Juror's are escorted from the courtroom.
Atty Cousins states his legal issue on the record.
Atty Cousins gives his argument in regards to the legal issue at hand.
10:50 a.m.  Atty Kryshak gives argument in regards to legal issue brought about by Atty Cousins.
BTC:   Court will not allow testimony from issues that happened 13 years ago due to it being prejudicial towards the defendant.
10:55 a.m.  Juror's have returned to the Courtroom.
Cross examination by Atty Kryshak.
Objection by Atty Cousins; overruled.
10:58 a.m.  Re-direct by Atty Cousins.
10:59 a.m.  Re-Cross by Atty Kryshak.
Witness is excused.
11:00 a.m.  Jessica Gustin is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
11:23 a.m.  Cross-examination by Atty Kryshak.
11:32 a.m.  Objection by Atty Cousins; overruled.
11:33 a.m.  Witness is excused.
11:34 a.m.  Justin Fleischman is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
11:38 a.m.  Cross-examination by Atty Kryshak.
11:40 a.m.  Re-direct by Atty Cousins.
11:41 a.m.  Objection by Atty Kryshak; sustained. 
Re-cross by Atty Kryshak.
11:42 a.m.  Witness is excused.
Rodney I Krakow is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
11:46 a.m.  Cross-examination by Atty Kryshak.
11:49 a.m.  Objection by Atty Cousins;  sustained.
11:50 a.m.  Witness is excused.
Court is in recess.
Juror's are excused and informed to return by 1:15 p.m.
1:17 p.m.  Juror's return to the Courtroom.
1:22 p.m.  Court is back in session.
Kassandra Borchardt is sworn in.
1:23 p.m.  Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
1:38 p.m.  Objection by Atty Kryshak; sustained.
1:40 p.m.  Objection by Atty Kryshak (form of question); overruled.
1:42 p.m.  Atty Cousins references Exhibit #1. 
1:43 p.m.  Atty Cousins moves Exhibit #1 into evidence.  No objection by Atty Kryshak.  Received by the Court.
1:46 p.m.  Objection by Atty Kryshak; sustained.
1:47 p.m.  Exhibit #2 is referenced by Atty Cousins.
1:48 p.m.  Objection by Atty Kryshak; overruled.
1:49 p.m.  Exhibit #3 is referenced by Atty Cousins.
Atty Cousins moves Exhibit #3 into evidence.  No objection by Atty Kryshak.  Received by the Court.
Cross-examination by Atty Kryshak.
1:56 p.m.  Re-direct by Atty Cousins.
1:59 p.m.  Re-cross by Atty Kryshak.
2:01 p.m.  Witness is excused.
2:02 p.m.  Court is in a brief recess.
**COURT REPORTER IS NOW CATHERINE SOSNOWSKI 
2:10 p.m.  Juror's return to the Courtroom.
2:12 p.m.  Court is back in session.
2:13 p.m.  Atty Cousins plays the video interview of A.F. (marked as exhibit #3)
2:48 p.m.  Video has finished and Court is in recess.
2:58 p.m.  Juror's return to the Courtroom.
3:00 p.m.  Atty Cousins plays the video interview for M.F. (marked as exhibit #3)
3:11 p.m.  Atty Cousins asks the Court to question the Juror's in regards to being able to hear the video; they are all able to do so.
4:05 p.m.  Video interview for M.F. has ended.
4:09 p.m.  Judge and Attorney's in Branch 1 to interview M.F. and Juror's, Clerk and Court Reporter with defendant remain in Branch 2 to view by video.
Direct examination by Atty Kryshak.
4:20 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Cousins.
4:22 p.m.  Re-direct by Atty Kryshak.
Witness is excused.
4:23 p.m.   Attorney's return to the Courtroom.
4:24 p.m.  Judge return's to the Courtroom.
Court puts on the record that the Attorney's, Judge, Family Members and Victim Witness Coordinator (stood by the witness) went to the Branch 1 Courtroom where M.F. was questioned by direct examination of Atty Kryshak and cross examination by Atty Cousins.
Atty Kryshak puts on ther record that they will not be questioning A.F.
4:26 p.m.  Joshua Ostrowski is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
4:30 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Kryshak.
4:31 p.m.  Re-direct by Atty Cousins.
Witness is excused.
Court will recess for the day and inform's the Juror's to return at 8:30 a.m. 
All exhibits collected by the Clerk.
Atty Cousins states that he will be calling Officer Bailey in the morning and Atty Kryshak has 3 witnesses and the defendant to call to the witness stand.
Atty Kryshak has additional jury instruction.

Pre-trial conference on December 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael V. Petta in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:34 p.m. Atty Cousins indicates Atty Kryshak is in a hearing in Conference Room E. 
Court will wait and call the case later. 

3:52 p.m.  Court recalls the case. 
Defendant Michael V. Petta in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Cousins indicates he has filed a Victim Key and asks that be kept sealed in the file. 
Atty Kryshak makes statements.  Is not sure that it needs to be sealed. 
Atty Cousins makes arguments. 

BY THE COURT:  Victim Key is ordered sealed pending further order of the Court. 
Court takes notice that Victim 2 is an individual who is 5 years old at this time.

David Bailey is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Cousins. 
Atty Kryshak stipulates the defendant is present and seated next to him. 
Direct exam continues. 
Cross exam by Atty Kryshak. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

No contact, direct/indirect, with Linda Petta or Jessica Gustin or be on premises where they reside. 
No contact, direct/indirect, with Victim 1 or Victim 2 whose names and Dates of Birth are to be provided and sealed in the Court file.

Defendant Michael V. Petta appeared by video. Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Atty Cousins recommends a $25,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Kryshak makes bond arguments to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Kryshak. 
Atty Cousins makes additional arguments to the Court.
Atty Kryshak makes additional arguments to the Court.

BY THE COURT: 
Victim 1 and Victim 2 names and dob's are to be provided and sealed in the Court file.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
